admin.intro: Ask which team they are and make sure that it is the right team in the right place, and that it matches the team listed above.

select_game.intro: Select which game you are judging

admin-referee-info.hamster_wheel:
Script:
Welcome to the Hamster Wheel.
  • At this station, you will compete against another team in a relay race. The team that wins and has the best time gets the most points.
  • The teams should get to one side and back as quickly as possible.
  • A team must have 15 participants in the wheel at the same time. There must be 15 participants inside the wheel throughout the course.
  • The whole team must perform the relay together. The team must go within the carpet with the carpet over their heads throughout the course.
  • As long as the team has enough participants, the people in the wheel can be replaced with 15 new people when the team is halfway through.
  • The team must cross the line with the entire wheel before they can change participants.
  • The team that is first back with the entire team over the start line wins. The time will also be recorded, so it is important for both teams to do it as quickly as possible even if they do not come in first place.
  • The team must stay within the carpet throughout the course. Each foot that hits the ground outside the carpet will add extra time. This also applies if the carpet is not over the participants' heads.
  • You have 2 minutes to get ready.
  • The task begins at my (the referee's) signal.
  • Is the task understood?
  • Then the teams can get ready at the start line. The group that will take over can stand on the other side of the track. Countdown of 2 minutes starts now.
  • The time is now up. Are all teams ready?
To the referee:
  • Two referees are placed on each side of the teams and register on their phones how often the teams step outside the band and each time the team does not have the fabric over their heads.
  • Make sure that participants and spectators have clear placements in relation to the game board for the game experience, insight, and engagement.

At the end of the game:
  • Collect the carpets and distribute them clearly for the next team that comes.
  • Straighten the starting line and other fences if necessary.
  • Prepare for a new group!
Health, Environment, and Safety:
  • Be aware that the hamster wheel involves many people walking at a high pace close to each other, which may result in some falling. This is considered a medium risk.
admin-referee-info.iron_grip:
Script:
Welcome to the Iron Grip.
  • The goal of this station is to accumulate the most 'hang-time' within 10 minutes.
  • Everyone can participate, but only 9 people hang at a time.
  • The team accumulates 'hang-time' when 9 people from the team are hanging from the scaffolding simultaneously.
  • The team has 10 minutes to complete the station.
  • When there are fewer than 9 participants hanging simultaneously, the time that accumulates for 'hang-time' stops until there are 9 participants hanging simultaneously again. Then the time starts again.
  • Participants who can no longer hang must stand at the back of the queue on the side of the scaffolding.
  • Only the participants who are hanging are allowed to be on the scaffolding; the rest of the team must stand in line, on the side of the scaffolding (point to the correct side).
  • If cheating occurs, the team will have 10 seconds deducted from the accumulated time.
  • Participants can only hang by their hands, without support from their legs, other participants, or objects.
  • The referee decides if something is cheating, but anything that helps participants hang without their own strength is considered cheating.
To the referees:
  • Have a timer that counts down from 10 minutes ready, which starts at the beginning of the competition.
  • Have a timer that is used for the accumulated 'hang-time', which stops each time there are fewer than 9 participants hanging from the scaffolding simultaneously, and starts again when 9 people hang simultaneously.
  • A participant can participate as many times as they want.
  • The team decides which participants they want to use to hang, and this can also change along the way.
  • Participants must hang by their hands, hanging straight down from the scaffolding, and cannot use legs, other participants, objects, etc., for help.
  • A referee monitors cheating. IMPORTANT: point out to the team that this is cheating, and then note it down.
  • Announce the following times: 5 minutes left, halfway! 2 minutes left, 1 minute left!

At the end of the game:
  • Register 'hang-time' and cheating in the app.
  • Safety routine: Check the scaffolding to ensure everything is secure after each round.
Health, Environment, and Safety:
  • Risk of falling from the scaffolding, sprains from falls, blisters on hands.
  • Where the station has asphalt as the surface, there will be mats.
admin-referee-info.labyrinth:
Script:
Welcome to the Labyrinth.
  • At this station, you must work together to get a ball through a labyrinth.
  • Up to 12 players work together at a time, and you have a maximum of ten minutes to complete the station.
  • There are two checkpoints in the labyrinth where the 12 players will be replaced by 12 new players.
  • It is not allowed to touch the ball with your hands when it is on the board or throw it up.
  • If the ball falls into a hole, one of the players must pick it up and place it back at the starting point or at the previous checkpoint, but it is only allowed to be under the labyrinth when the ball falls through a hole.
  • You get two points for each checkpoint you pass, and more points the faster you complete.
  • When the labyrinth is completed or time is up, you can place the labyrinth calmly on the ground.
  • The game starts when a referee places the ball on the starting point.
  • Is the task understood?
  • Then 12 players can get ready to start on the labyrinth, and the rest of the team can stand over here (point where it is beneficial for the rest of the team to stand).
  • 12 new players must be ready to take over at the checkpoints.
  • Then we start. Ready, set, go!
To the referee:
  • Control the crowds and place spectators in the best possible position.
  • Be ready to start the countdown of 10 minutes when the team starts.
  • Ensure that all players change with a new player at the checkpoints.
  • Ensure that participants do not break any rules.
  • Stop the game after 10 minutes if the team has not already completed the task.

At the end of the game:
  • Collect all the balls that have been in play.
  • Prepare for new groups!
Health, Environment, and Safety:
  • Risk associated with this station is that participants may drop the labyrinth on their feet. If the ball falls through a hole, participants must be careful when picking it up so that they do not get the labyrinth over them. Splinters or blisters on the palm may occur.
admin-referee-info.land_water_beach:
Script:
Welcome to Land, Water, Beach.
  • At this station, you will compete against another team to react as quickly as possible and move between three zones on three different signals.
  • Ten people from each team start in the middle zone, the beach.
  • The three signals you should react to are:
    • Red signal means you should move to the back zone, land.
    • Yellow signal is the middle zone, beach.
    • Blue signal is the front zone, water.
  • The team where all ten players move first to the correct zone gets one point. If both teams are equally fast, both teams get one point.
  • The players must remain in the zone they move to.
  • There are three signals shown before the ten players are replaced with ten new players. This is done for a total of three rounds.
  • You get points based on how many rounds you win.
  • Is the task understood?
  • Then ten players can start in the middle zone, and the rest of the team can stand there and be ready to replace the ten players (point to the best place for the rest of the team to stand).
  • Then we start. Ready, set, go!
To the referees:
  • Ensure that the rest of the team stands in an appropriate place and is ready to replace ten new players for each round.
  • Ensure that the time does not exceed 15 minutes in total for the station.
  • The head referee shows points on the scoreboard.
  • Two line referees with flags make a quick decision on who gets points.
  • The person in the signal box must vary the signal and the time between the signals.

At the end of the game:
  • Ensure that the zones are still clearly marked.
Health, Environment, and Safety:
  • There is little risk associated with this station; stumbling, sprains, or falls may occur. Be aware of this.
admin-referee-info.mastermind:
Script:
Welcome to Mastermind.
  • The goal of this station is to figure out what color code is in the suitcase.
  • You get 8 rounds and a maximum of 10 minutes to solve the task.
  • You get more points the fewer rounds you use to get to the correct code.
  • You should now pick 5 Codebreakers.
  • These 5 have the main task of solving the task.
  • The rest will be given a color (Durag - headgear) that represents a game piece that Codebreakers can place on the board.
  • All participants who are game pieces must have the headgear on their heads at all times during the game. (Have the durag on hand to show)
  • Codebreakers fetch the game pieces (participants with headgear) they want to use and place them on a black game piece on the game board.
  • When Codebreakers have given their answer, a referee will place 'answer-pins' that tell Codebreakers how close they are to the answer.
    • Red pin = correct color in the correct place
    • White pin = correct color in the wrong place
    (Have the pins in hand and show them)
  • When Codebreakers have guessed the correct color code, a referee will go forward and open the box.
  • The rest of the team stands on the side of the game board.
  • Is the task understood?
  • Then Codebreakers can go to that referee (point and show).
  • All those who will be game pieces can stand over there (point and show).
  • Then we start. Ready, set, go!
To the referee:
  • Ensure that the audience, game pieces, and codebreakers have clear placements in relation to the game board for the game experience, insight, and engagement.

At the end of the game:
  • Collect all headgear.
  • Collect all answer-pins.
  • Change the color code in the box.
  • Adjust the game board if necessary.
  • Prepare for new groups!
Health, Environment, and Safety:
  • The risk associated with this station is that participants may trip over the game pieces on the game board. This is considered very low to low risk.

points-registration-error: Calculated result returned undefined. The form is invalid even though it can be submitted. You may be missing some validation on form fields.
something-went-wrong-we-could-not-log-yo: Something went wrong, we could not log you in - please try again.
